content.body: https://github.com/w3c/spec-maintenance/wiki/Spec-list is the new home for the list I started of _“specs/needs we don’t currently have people maintaining or working on as actively as we’d like to”_.
content.formatted_body: https://github.com/w3c/spec-maintenance/wiki/Spec-list is the new home for the list I started of “specs/needs we don’t currently have people maintaining or working on as actively as we’d like to”.

content.body: It’s a wiki, so you can make additions/changes to it directly yourself — without needing to do a PR.
Or if you prefer, you can also clone it from https://github.com/w3c/spec-maintenance.wiki.git and make changes to it locally and the push your changes back in the normal git-GitHub way.
I added WebVTT to the list.
* Or if you prefer, you can also clone it from https://github.com/w3c/spec-maintenance.wiki.git and make changes to it locally and then push your changes back in the normal git-GitHub way.

m.new_content.body: Or if you prefer, you can also clone it from https://github.com/w3c/spec-maintenance.wiki.git and make changes to it locally and then push your changes back in the normal git-GitHub way.

content.body: Specifically firing cancel, close however is handled by just calling close the dialog, which itself already handles the firing of events manually.
Sure, currently the sequence is closeSteps -> close the dialog -> close event. Cutting out 1/3 of those means we need to ensure that that 1/3 stays in sync.
AtkinsSJ: if you could take a look at https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11224 & https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11228 I'd appreciate it
content.formatted_body: AtkinsSJ: if you could take a look at https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11224 & https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11228 I'd appreciate it
